channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump snatches Maduro but leaves his regime in charge for now
item.description: For now, there’s no plan spelled out to have American troops or administrators in Venezuela.

item.title: Before Maduro arrest, Nobel Prize winner said Venezuela has a $1.7 trillion opportunity to privatize over 500 companies and undo socialist ‘disaster’
item.description: Venezuela has the world’s largest oil reserves, but “our people don’t even have gas even to cook. That’s a disaster,” María Corina Machado told Fortun...

item.title: Deploying U.S. troops in Venezuela could become a ‘force protection nightmare’ amid potential insurgency threat, retired colonel warns
item.description: "The risk with Venezuela is that it could be a hostile environment as well, and that could put U.S. forces in great danger."

item.title: Countries must move beyond seeing AI as a race, where one side must beat the other
item.description: When it comes to AI, cooperation between countries can yield greater benefits than working alone.

item.title: Second front: How a socialist cell in the US mobilized pro-Maduro foot soldiers within 12 hours

item.title: Kamala Harris blasts Trump administration’s capture of Venezuela’s Maduro as ‘unlawful and unwise’
item.description: Kamala Harris condemns Trump's capture of Venezuelan dictator Maduro as 'unlawful and unwise,' warning of potential chaos and questioning oil motives.

item.title: Strange Days at the Modern Language Association
item.description: Sadly, the organization’s upcoming conference will further delegitimize the humanities.

item.title: US capture of Maduro throws spotlight on Venezuela’s massive oil reserves
item.description: Despite holding the world’s largest oil reserves, Venezuela’s oil industry has been hollowed out by economic collapse under President Nicolás Maduro.

item.title: Highs and Lows at Princeton’s New Art Museum
item.description: It looks great, but is the curatorial vision awry?

item.title: Venezuelan immigrants celebrate U.S. capture of Maduro
item.description: Venezuelans in the U.S. took to the streets to celebrate the apprehension of President Nicolas Maduro in an overnight military raid on Caracas.

item.title: Cold, Confusion, and ‘Resistance’ Buttons: On the Ground at Mamdani’s Inauguration
item.description: Members of the Democratic Socialists of America were seen handing out flyers, in a definitional example of preaching to the converted.

item.title: Minneapolis Daycares Only the Tip of the Fraud Scandal
item.description: Nick Shirley’s viral video is useful, but the focus should be on nailing as many of the malefactors as possible.

item.title: Trump seeks to make Venezuela great again and revive its oil-based economy while affordability crisis lingers in the U.S.
item.description: "We have tremendous energy in that country. It's very important that we protect it. We need that for ourselves."

item.title: Without George Washington, America Wouldn’t Have A 250th Birthday
item.description: No one looms larger in the story of our nation's struggle for independence than George Washington, who today seems almost mythical.

item.title: It’s Not Just Minnesota. The Vast Majority Of Daycare Is A Scam
item.description: Taxpayers have spent hundreds of billions more on completely ineffective daycare than even Somalis have been able to pilfer.
